description: Badurdeen Mohammed Rasheed Vs R. M. R. S. Thilakarathne,  Divisional Secretary of Buttala and Eight Others - before Hon. Wickum A. Kaluarachchi, J
parties: Badurdeen Mohammed Rasheed Vs R. M. R. S. Thilakarathne,  Divisional Secretary of Buttala and Eight Others -
keywords: Locus standi. - A petitioner who acquired an interest from activities done contrary to law are not entitled for standing. - No prescriptive title could be acquired to state land alienated on a permit under Land Development Ordinance. - Legitimate expectations. - Violators of Law are not entitled to legitimate expectations
